page.title: 16BY-PASS
page.content: A By-pass is being built around our village to ease the traffic congestion. This is caused by lorries on their way to and from the Midlands to Felixstowe Docks during the week and on summer Saturdays by holiday traffic, on its way to the Broads or Norfolk coast. A school traffic count found that about 10000 vehicles pass through Ixworth each day. During the sugar beet campaign (October - January) there is a lot more(The factory is in Bury St.Edmunds). The by-pass leaves the A143 just south of the village and passes to the east. Roundabouts are to be positioned on the A1088 Stowmarket Road and on the Walsham-le-Willows Road. From the latter the road will join the A1088 Thetford Road. The cost will be about 3 million pounds. It is due to open in 1986.
